name: Roo.bootstrap.layout.Split
desc: Adds a splitbar and other (private) useful functionality to a {@link Roo.LayoutRegion}.

config.name: listeners
cmargins
config.desc: Margins for the element when collapsed (defaults to: north/south {top: 2, left: 0, right:0, bottom: 2} or east/west {top: 0, left: 2, right:2, bottom: 0})

config.name: alwaysShowTabs
config.desc: True to always display tabs even when there is only 1 panel (defaults to false)

config.name: margins
config.desc: Margins for the element (defaults to {top: 0, left: 0, right:0, bottom: 0})

config.name: preferredTabWidth
config.desc: The preferred tab width (defaults to 150)

config.name: disableTabTips
config.desc: True to disable tab tooltips

config.name: collapsible
config.desc: False to disable collapsing (defaults to true)

config.name: collapsedTitle
config.desc: Optional string message to display in the collapsed block of a north or south region

config.name: autoScroll
config.desc: True to enable overflow scrolling (defaults to false)

config.name: hidden
config.desc: True to start the region hidden (defaults to false)

config.name: toolbar
config.desc: xtype configuration for a toolbar - shows on right of tabbar

config.name: title
config.desc: The title for the region (overrides panel titles)

config.name: hideWhenEmpty
config.desc: True to hide the region when it has no panels

config.name: collapsed
config.desc: True to set the initial display to collapsed (defaults to false)

config.name: hideTabs
config.desc: True to hide the tab strip (defaults to false)

config.name: resizeTabs
config.desc:
True to enable automatic tab resizing. This will resize the tabs so they are all the same size and fit within
                     the space available, similar to FireFox 1.5 tabs (defaults to false)

config.name: tabPosition
config.desc: "top" or "bottom" (defaults to "bottom")

config.name: width
config.desc: For East/West panels

config.name: floatable
config.desc: False to disable floating (defaults to true)

config.name: minTabWidth
config.desc: The minimum tab width (defaults to 40)

config.name: split
config.desc: To show the splitter

config.name: titlebar
config.desc: True to display a title bar (defaults to true)

config.name: preservePanels
config.desc: True to preserve removed panels so they can be readded later (defaults to false)

config.name: closeOnTab
config.desc: True to place the close icon on the tabs instead of the region titlebar (defaults to false)

config.name: height
config.desc: For North/South panels

config.name: animate
config.desc: True to animate expand/collapse (defaults to false)

config.name: autoHide
config.desc: False to disable auto hiding when the mouse leaves the "floated" region (defaults to true)

config.name: showPin
config.desc: True to show a pin button

methods.name: getSplitBar
methods.desc: Returns the {@link Roo.SplitBar} for this region.

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the container element for this region.

methods.name: remove
methods.desc: Removes the specified panel. If preservePanel is not true (either here or in the config), the panel is destroyed.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The panel's index, id or the panel itself

params.name: preservePanel
params.desc: Overrides the config preservePanel option

methods.name: getActivePanel
methods.desc: Get the active panel for this region.

methods.name: collapse
methods.desc: Collapses this region.

params.name: skipAnim
params.desc: (optional) true to collapse the element without animation (if animate is true)

methods.name: unhidePanel
methods.desc: Unhides the tab for a previously hidden panel.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The panel's index, id or the panel itself

methods.name: setCollapsedTitle
methods.desc: Updates the title for collapsed north/south regions (used with {@link #collapsedTitle} config option)

params.name: title
params.desc: (optional) The title text (accepts HTML markup, defaults to the numeric character reference for a non-breaking space, "&#160;")

methods.name: getTabs
methods.desc: Returns the TabPanel component used by this region

methods.name: expand
methods.desc: Expands this region if it was previously collapsed.

params.name: e
params.desc: The event that triggered the expand (or null if calling manually)

params.name: skipAnim
params.desc: (optional) true to expand the element without animation (if animate is true)

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Returns true if this region is currently visible.

methods.name: showPanel
methods.desc: Shows the specified panel.

params.name: panelId
params.desc: The panel's index, id or the panel itself

returns.desc: The shown panel, or null if a panel could not be found from panelId

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hides this region.

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Shows this region if it was previously hidden.

methods.name: add
methods.desc: Adds the passed ContentPanel(s) to this region.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The ContentPanel(s) to add (you can pass more than one)

returns.desc: The panel added (if only one was added; null otherwise)

methods.name: hidePanel
methods.desc: Hides the tab for the specified panel.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The panel's index, id or the panel itself

methods.name: hasPanel
methods.desc: Returns true if the panel is in this region.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The panels index, id or the panel itself

methods.name: resizeTo
methods.desc:
Resizes the region to the specified size. For vertical regions (west, east) this adjusts 
the width, for horizontal (north, south) the height.

params.name: newSize
params.desc: The new width or height

methods.name: getPosition
methods.desc: Returns this regions position (north/south/east/west/center).

methods.name: getPanel
methods.desc: Returns the panel specified or null if it's not in this region.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The panels index, id or the panel itself

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional)

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to release

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

returns.desc: returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

returns.desc: True if the event is being listened for, else false

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to capture

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options

events.name: paneladded
events.desc: Fires when a panel is added.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The panel

events.name: invalidated
events.desc: Fires when the layout for this region is changed.

events.name: expanded
events.desc: Fires when this region is expanded.

events.name: beforeremove
events.desc: Fires before a panel is removed (or closed). To cancel the removal set "e.cancel = true" on the event argument.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The panel

params.name: e
params.desc: The cancel event object

events.name: collapsed
events.desc: Fires when this region is collapsed.

events.name: panelremoved
events.desc: Fires when a panel is removed.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The panel

events.name: beforecollapse
events.desc: Fires when this region before collapse.

events.name: slidehide
events.desc: Fires when this region slides out of view.

events.name: visibilitychange
events.desc: Fires when this region is shown or hidden

params.name: visibility
params.desc: true or false

events.name: slideshow
events.desc: Fires when this region is slid into view.

events.name: panelactivated
events.desc: Fires when a panel is activated.

params.name: panel
params.desc: The activated panel

events.name: resized
events.desc: Fires when the user resizes this region.

params.name: newSize
params.desc: The new size (width for east/west, height for north/south)
